result.execSummary:
The defendant Taza T. Carter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misdemeanor Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Taza T. Carter

records.addlTxt:
9:39 AM Defendant Taza T. Carter in court.  Attorney Kerry A. Kelm in court for Taza T. Carter.  Deputy District Attorney Angela Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This is the date and time set for a hearing. The parties have an agreement.  State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 

Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count 1: Misdemeanor Battery without the repeater. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights.  Court accepts plea and finds the defendant guilty. Court orders court costs and DNA sample and surcharge.

10:21 AM Defendant Taza T. Carter in court.  Attorney Kerry A. Kelm appeared by video for Taza T. Carter.  Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Kelm does not have an offer in this case. 
09/28/22 at 9:30am
Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Case called at 9:51 AM.
Prosecuting Attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Taza T. Carter in court with Attorney Kerry A. Kelm.
Attorney Kelm was recently appointed and requests RTN.
Hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.
